dt.t: a dog with its tongue {wi}lolling{/wi} out

dt: {bc}to act or move in a lax, lazy, or {d_link|indolent|indolent} manner {bc}{sx|lounge||}

dt.t: He {wi}lolled{/wi} around in his pajamas all day.

pt: {sc}idle{/sc} {sc}loaf{/sc} {sc}lounge{/sc} {sc}loll{/sc} {sc}laze{/sc} mean to spend time doing nothing. {sc}idle{/sc} may be used in reference to persons that move lazily or without purpose.
{sc}loaf{/sc} suggests either resting or wandering about as though there were nothing to do.

pt.t: she does her work and then {it}loafs{/it} the rest of the day

pt: {sc}lounge{/sc}, though occasionally used as equal to {it}idle{/it} or {it}loaf{/it}, typically conveys an additional implication of resting or reclining against a support or of physical comfort and ease in relaxation.
{sc}loll{/sc} also carries an implication of a posture similar to that of {it}lounge{/it}, but places greater stress upon an indolent or relaxed attitude.
{sc}laze{/sc} usually implies the relaxation of a busy person enjoying a vacation or moments of leisure.

shortdef: to hang loosely or laxly : droop
to act or move in a lax, lazy, or indolent manner : lounge
the act of lolling : a relaxed posture
